# Welcome Everyone! {.smaller}

Good evening everyone and welcome to the fifth event hosted by the `R-Ladies Rome` chapter. My name is `Federica Gazzelloni` and I am one of the chapter's organizers. I am thrilled to have you all here tonight. I am also joined by our co-organizer, `Katie Jane Wood`, who is an expert Marketing professional and recently joined our team.

Tonight, we are honored to have a very special guest, our esteemed speaker, `Jon Harmon`. 

...

Benvenuti! Questo è il quinto evento per questo gruppo `RLadies Rome`.
Io sono Federica Gazzelloni una delle organizzatrici, con me c'è Katie
Jane Wood l'altra co-organizer, professionista marketing in diversi
settori, incluso il farmaceutico.

Questa sera `Jon Harmon` è il nostro ospite, ci parlerà della sua
esperienza con R4DS una open learning community.

Tutto il materiale verrà condiviso durante la presentazione se volete
potete dare un'occhiata al sito: <https://www.rfordatasci.com/>.

# What is R-Ladies? {.smaller}

::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
-   `R-Ladies` is a global organization with the mission of promoting
    the R language and for empowering women at all user levels by
    building a collaborative global network.
-   It is a gender diversity friendly community founded in 2012 by
    [Gabriela de
    Queiroz](https://rladies.org/united-states-rladies/name/gabriela-de-queiroz/)
    in San Francisco.
-   `R-Ladies` is now a **world-wide organization** with 218 chapters in
    29 countries and more than 93,000 members globally.

For more information, please visit [rladies.org](rladies.org)
:::

## R-Ladies {.smaller}

::: panel-tabset
### R-Ladies Rome

> **`R-Ladies Rome`** is a local chapter of **`R-Ladies Global`**
> dedicated to promoting gender diversity in the R language community.
> Our monthly meetings provide a platform to discuss current trends and
> **hot topics in R**, and we encourage active participation and
> engagement from all attendees. We welcome your suggestions and
> comments, and invite you to get in touch to join our vibrant
> community.

Organizers and Volunteers:

`Founder` of the chapter is [Claudia
Vitolo](https://rladies.org/italy-rladies/name/claudia-vitolo/). She is
also a Co-founder of `R-Ladies Global`

`Organizer` of the chapter is [Federica
Gazzelloni](https://federicagazzelloni.netlify.app)

`Co-Organizer` is [Katie Jane
Wood](https://www.linkedin.com/in/katie-wood-omca%E2%84%A2-92060817/)

We expect more co-organizers to join us soon.

# Tonight's presentation {.smaller}

Welcome to this exciting event! 

It is my pleasure to pass the word to our speaker for today's event. He is a highly respected expert in his field and has been a leader in the R community for many years. As the Chief Community Manager of `R4DS Online Learning Community`, he has mentored and coordinated a diverse group of R learners, helping them to improve their skills and abilities. He is here today to share his valuable insights and practical tips on managing time zones and scheduling events for a global audience. Please join me in welcoming our speaker, `Jon Harmon`.
